titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Collection of Norwegian Bookplates
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Rino Landa

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 00:03

did.abstract: The collection consists of bookplates commissioned by Norwegian individuals and institutions.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Some materials included in this collection indicate the provenance of the following collectors: Irene D. Andrews Pace, Baron Gunnar Trönnberg of Sweden, and Arvid Berghman.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Yale Bookplate Collection was formerly housed in Sterling Memorial Library. The collection was incorporated into the Arts of the Book Collection in 1984 and then moved to the Seeley G. Mudd Library in 1990. In 2011 it was transferred to the Robert B. Haas Family Arts Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has not been transferred to Yale University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Collection of Norwegian Bookplates, Robert B. Haas Family Arts Library, Yale University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of both private and institutional bookplates from Norway as well as ephemeral materials related to the collection.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three series: I. Bookplates - Individuals. II. Bookplates - Organizations, Institutions, and Businesses. III. Correspondence and Ephemera. The arrangement preserves the original alphabetical ordering by which special letters and those with diacritical marks were sorted at the end of the alphabet. Any correspondence or ephemeral materials relating to a specific bookplate are filed together with the bookplate.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by the patron's surname.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: A collection of various library, university, social organization, and business bookplates arranged alphabetically.

did.unittitle: Amstelodami, Bibliotheca Norvegica – Fra Nordmenn I Amerika

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series contains correspondence and other materials without attached bookplates.

did.unittitle: Postcard; Book: Norske Ex Libris Signaturer (1948)

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Postcard 195[?] Jan 18 to Admiral & Mrs. E. M. Pace, Jr.

Book inscribed on inside front cover, "To- Mrs. Edmund Andrews"; possibly signed by the author [Schyberg]. Also pasted onto the inside front cover is a bookplate of Irene Dwen Pace, designed and signed by Herbert Ott.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three subseries: Patrons, Artists, and Duplicates.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by the bookplate patron.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by the artist's name, then alphabetically by patron within each artist's folder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a few pamphlets about Schjaerven's ex-libris.
